question: Which of the following was the main feature of the policy of Dual Government of British rulers in India?
option1: The English collected the revenues with the help of Indian Officials and they became virtually the head of the civil and military administration
option2: The general administrative body consisted of two categories of rulers
option3: Main items of administration were in the hands of local kings and rest were in the hands of British rulers
option4: Some portions of land were ruled by the local kings and rest by the British rulers
answer: The English collected the revenues with the help of Indian Officials and they became virtually the head of the civil and military administration
explanation: The Dual System of Government in Bengal was the brainchild of Lord Clive. Dual Government means double system of administration. In this system, the power is divided into two: the administrative power, and the revenue collection power. While the former is given to the native rulers, the british have taken charge of the latter.
